span.title: Declares support for automated dicovery of OAuth2 endpoints If a server requires SMART on FHIR authorization for access. Any time a client sees this extension, it must be prepared to authorize using SMART's OAuth2-based protocol.

name.value: Support for dicovery of OAuth2 endpoints

publisher.value: Boston's Children Hospital and Hl7 International

description.value: Declares support for automated dicovery of OAuth2 endpoints If a server requires SMART on FHIR authorization for access. Any time a client sees this extension, it must be prepared to authorize using SMART's OAuth2-based protocol.

short.value: Support for dicovery of OAuth2 endpoints

definition.value: Declares support for automated dicovery of OAuth2 endpoints If a server requires SMART on FHIR authorization for access. Any time a client sees this extension, it must be prepared to authorize using SMART's OAuth2-based protocol.

short.value: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)

definition.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

short.value: Uri indicating the OAuth2 "authorize" endpoint for this FHIR server.

definition.value: valueUri indicating the OAuth2 "authorize" endpoint for this FHIR server.

short.value: Uri indicating the OAuth2 "token" endpoint for this FHIR server. Required unless the implicit grant flow is used.

definition.value: Uri indicating the OAuth2 "token" endpoint for this FHIR server.

short.value: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)

definition.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

short.value: Additional Content defined by implementations

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comments.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

short.value: identifies the meaning of the extension

definition.value: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

comments.value: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition should be version specific. This will ideally be the URI for the Resource Profile defining the extension, with the code for the extension after a #.

short.value: Value of extension

definition.value: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).

short.value: Uri indicating the OAuth2 dynamic registration endpoint for this FHIR server, if supported.

The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

short.value: identifies the meaning of the extension

definition.value: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

comments.value: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition should be version specific. This will ideally be the URI for the Resource Profile defining the extension, with the code for the extension after a #.

short.value: Value of extension

definition.value: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).

short.value: Uri indicating the endpoint that can be used to revoke a token.

definition.value: Uri indicating the endpoint that can be used to revoke a token.

short.value: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)

definition.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

short.value: Additional Content defined by implementations

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comments.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

The definition should be version specific. This will ideally be the URI for the Resource Profile defining the extension, with the code for the extension after a #.

definition.value: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).

short.value: Support for dicovery of OAuth2 endpoints

definition.value: Declares support for automated dicovery of OAuth2 endpoints If a server requires SMART on FHIR authorization for access. Any time a client sees this extension, it must be prepared to authorize using SMART's OAuth2-based protocol.

short.value: Uri indicating the OAuth2 "authorize" endpoint for this FHIR server.

definition.value: valueUri indicating the OAuth2 "authorize" endpoint for this FHIR server.

short.value: Uri indicating the OAuth2 "token" endpoint for this FHIR server. Required unless the implicit grant flow is used.

definition.value: Uri indicating the OAuth2 "token" endpoint for this FHIR server.

short.value: Uri indicating the OAuth2 dynamic registration endpoint for this FHIR server, if supported.

definition.value: Uri indicating the OAuth2 dynamic registration endpoint for this FHIR server, if supported.

short.value: Uri indicating the user-facing authorization management workflow entry point for this FHIR server. Overview in this presentation

definition.value: Uri indicating the user-facing authorization management workflow entry point for this FHIR server. Overview in this presentation.

short.value: Uri indicating the introspection endpoint that can be used to validate a token.

definition.value: Uri indicating the introspection endpoint that can be used to validate a token.

short.value: Uri indicating the endpoint that can be used to revoke a token.

definition.value: Uri indicating the endpoint that can be used to revoke a token.
